pageContext.claim: “Today I'm here to say we are not backing down on our effort to determine the citizenship status of the United States population.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump said he was not backing down, because the administration is still endeavoring to count citizens, residents and undocumented immigrants. But in legal terms, the president conceded defeat. Trump and Attorney General William P. Barr confirmed in these Rose Garden remarks that they would no longer seek to add a citizenship question to the 2020 Census form.
